title.rendered: What is Firebase?

content.rendered:
Firebase is a platform which is used for building Web, IOS and Android applications.

It offers:

  • Real time database
  • Different APIs
  • Multiple authentication types
  • and Hosting platform

excerpt.rendered: Firebase is a platform which is used for building Web, IOS and Android applications. It offers: Real time database Different APIs Multiple authentication types and Hosting platform

title.rendered: What are the features of Firebase?

content.rendered:
Features of firebase are:

  • Hosting
  • Authentication
  • Real-time Database

excerpt.rendered: Features of firebase are: Hosting Authentication Real-time Database

title.rendered: Who is the Founder of Firebase?

content.rendered: James Tamplin is the founder of Firebase.

excerpt.rendered: James Tamplin is the founder of Firebase.

title.rendered: What is Push Method in Firebase?

content.rendered:
The push() method is used, When the data is pushed.

The push() method will create a unique id.

excerpt.rendered: The push() method is used, When the data is pushed. The push() method will create a unique id.

title.rendered: What is Key Method in Firebase?

content.rendered: By using the key() method, We can get any key from Firebase.

excerpt.rendered: By using the key() method, We can get any key from Firebase.

title.rendered: What is Set Method in Firebase?

content.rendered: The Set Method is used to write or replace data on a specified method.The Set Method is used to write or replace data on a specified method.

excerpt.rendered: The Set Method is used to write or replace data on a specified method.The Set Method is used to write or replace data on a specified method.

title.rendered: What is Transactional data in Firebase?

content.rendered: The Transactional data is used to return some data from the database.

excerpt.rendered: The Transactional data is used to return some data from the database.

title.rendered: What is limitToFirst method in Firebase?

content.rendered: It is used to returns the specified number of items beginning from the first one.

excerpt.rendered: It is used to returns the specified number of items beginning from the first one.

title.rendered: What is limitToLast method in Firebase?

content.rendered: It is used to returns a specified number of items beginning from the last one.

excerpt.rendered: It is used to returns a specified number of items beginning from the last one.

title.rendered: What are the advantages of Firebase?

content.rendered:
Features of Firebase are:

  • It offers simple control dashboard
  • Number of useful services to choose
  • Here, the data is real time which means that every change will update automatically
  • It is user friendly and simple

title.rendered: What are the filtering methods in Firebase?

content.rendered:
Firebase filtering methods are:

  • startAt() method
  • endAt() method
  • equalTo() method etc

excerpt.rendered: Firebase filtering methods are: startAt() method endAt() method equalTo() method etc

value

title.rendered: What is off() method in Firebase?

content.rendered: The off() method is used to remove all callbacks with value event type.

excerpt.rendered: The off() method is used to remove all callbacks with value event type.

content.rendered: createUserWithEmailAndPassword(email, password) method.

title.rendered: What is the use of on() method in Firebase?

content.rendered: on() method: This method is used to retrieve data.

title.rendered: What is the use of child_changed method?

content.rendered: child_changed: This is an event type which is triggered when the data has changed.

title.rendered: What is the use of child_removed method?

content.rendered: child_removed: This is an event type which is triggered when we want to remove data.

title.rendered: What is a Firebase Project?

content.rendered:
Firebase Project: Firebase project is a container for apps.

Firebase project supports many features such as Database, Config and Notifications between your cross-platform apps.

excerpt.rendered: Firebase Project: Firebase project is a container for apps. Firebase project supports many features such as Database, Config and Notifications between your cross-platform apps.

title.rendered: What is the use of Sha-1 in Firebase?

content.rendered: Sha-1: Sha-1 is only required if you are using either Firebase Dynamic Links or Firebase Invites. It is used to simplify the Google Sign-In configuration with Firebase Authentication.

excerpt.rendered: Sha-1: Sha-1 is only required if you are using either Firebase Dynamic Links or Firebase Invites. It is used to simplify the Google Sign-In configuration with Firebase Authentication.

title.rendered: What are the supported browsers for accessing Firebase Console?

content.rendered: The supported browsers for accessing Firebase Console are Chrome, Firefox, Safari and IE.

excerpt.rendered: The supported browsers for accessing Firebase Console are Chrome, Firefox, Safari and IE.

title.rendered: Do I need to use other Firebase Services in order to use FCM?

content.rendered: No, you don’t need to use other Firebase Services. You can use FCM as a standalone component.

excerpt.rendered: No, you don’t need to use other Firebase Services. You can use FCM as a standalone component.

title.rendered: What is the use Firebase Analytics?

content.rendered:
Firebase Analytics enables you to view:Firebase Analytics enables you to view:

Event logs in Firebase Crash Reporting
 
Notification effectiveness in Firebase Notifications
 
Deep link performance for Firebase Dynamic Links
 
In-app purchase data from Google Play

excerpt.rendered: Firebase Analytics enables you to view:Firebase Analytics enables you to view:

title.rendered: What are the full forms of FCM and GCM in Firebase?

content.rendered: FCM and GCM stands for Firebase Cloud Messaging and Google Cloud Messaging respectively.

excerpt.rendered: FCM and GCM stands for Firebase Cloud Messaging and Google Cloud Messaging respectively.

title.rendered: What are the Real time database limits in Firebase?

content.rendered:
The Real time database limits are:

  • Simultaneous connections added are 100,000.
  • Simultaneous responses sent from a single database are 100,000/second.
  • The number of cloud functions triggered by a single write is 1000.
  • The size of database write that triggers a function is 1 MB.

excerpt.rendered: The Real time database limits are: Simultaneous connections added are 100,000. Simultaneous responses sent from a single database are 100,000/second. The number of cloud functions triggered by a single write is 1000. The size of database write that triggers a function is 1 MB.

content.rendered: getInvitation API.

.validate
 
.indexOn
